title: TECH BY 20 Promotes Growing Technology Corridor September 29 - MyArkLaMiss (press release) (blog)
text:
TECH BY 20 Promotes Growing Technology Corridor September 29 
Published 09/28 2015 10:22AM 
Updated 09/28 2015 10:22AM Copyright 2015 Nexstar Broadcasting, Inc. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. MONROE, La. -- 
TECH BY 20 will hold its next technology event Tuesday, September 29 from 6:00 pm to 8:00 pm at the CenturyLink Technology Center of Excellence, 100 CenturyLink Drive, Monroe, LA. 
The meeting, entitled "Cyber Security - a 360 Degree View," will feature top IT security leaders. 
The event is free and open to the public. 
Speakers include John Knies, CenturyLink chief information security officer; Joshua Tannehill, CenturyLink senior information security engineer and founder of the NELA InfoSec group; and Todd Trimble, IBM security architect. 
The increased need for talent with various technology skills has been driven by growth in our technology sector from companies moving into or expanding in North Louisiana. 
Strong business recruitment efforts by state, regional and local economic development organizations and attractive incentives have brought new technology companies to the region. 
In response to this growing need for knowledge workers, K-12 and higher education partners are developing new technology curricula. 
One such academic program is Louisiana Tech Universityâ€™s first-in-the-nation Bachelor of Science degree in Cyber Engineering. 
University of Louisiana at Monroe offers Accounting, Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, and Finance programs geared toward equipping students with technology skills in order to support regional employers.
